\underline{Theorem}
Say we have $\mu_0 , \mu_1$ as probability measures on $\mathbb{R}^d$. Let $\tau_{\mu_0 , \mu_1} = \{ T: \mathbb{R}^d \rightarrow \mathbb{R}^d |T_{\#\mu_0} = \mu_1 \}$
- T preserves mass conservation requirement 
- sometimes set may be empty

$$\mu_0 = \delta_a \hspace{.5cm} c \neq a \hspace{.5cm} \mu_1 = \frac{1}{2}(\delta_a + \delta_c) $$
